item.title: Awesome animated first person video
item.dc:creator: Eric_Fong
item.description:
ac3d:

Trying to kill them while they’re running towards you is fun, but the quick time events aren’t, press the button in time or get eaten it’s pretty much a “Would you like to die? Yes or No?” situation.

Get these COD shit out of here.

item.title: Awesome animated first person video
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
k3nny1550:

In Episode One it felt like they just threw the thing in there near the end of the game for continuity’s sake. Barely used the thing.

It was thrown is as a joke moreso than anything. You already have the gravity gun & real guns, yet barney gives you a shitty little stick & sends you on your way, the same way he did in HL2.

Trying to turn the crowbar into the TF2 spy’s knife just seems pointless because there aren’t any real places for stealth in HL games (adding some would be retarded) especially when the enemies have such a high field of view. There’s a reason why people fight with guns instead of crowbars or clubs, they’re just better.

faelnor:

I honestly don’t care about this video from an animation point of view, what I love is this video’s ability to make me think about how it could be done within a game environment without scripting.

The only thing that happens in the video any differently than in the games are the animations & being disarmed & pinned to the ground like a L4D hunter & fending it off like a QTE. There really is no new gameplay here that hasn’t been done before & that would actually fit in with half-life.

Read full topic

item.title: Awesome animated first person video
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
I hope at some point Valve will let players do instant kill animations with the crowbar in conjunction with a pistol- hook the enemy behind their head with the end of the crowbar, and then blast it off with the gun. Or at least find a way to make the crowbar more useful. In Episode One it felt like they just threw the thing in there near the end of the game for continuity’s sake. Barely used the thing.

item.title: Awesome animated first person video
item.dc:creator: faelnor
item.description:
And it’s obvious that if one day we see that in a valve game, it won’t be a QT or scripted event but a dynamic game interaction. That’s exactly the kind of gameplay enhancement that valve are all about. I honestly don’t care about this video from an animation point of view, what I love is this video’s ability to make me think about how it could be done within a game environment without scripting.

Read full topic

item.title: Awesome animated first person video
item.dc:creator: Eric_Fong
item.description:
Omega_Absolute:

He said “What?” because this has nothing to do with gameplay or any game developers or any of that jazz you were talking about. It’s a animations test made by some guy trying to build a portfolio or something. Nobody was striving for gameplay enhancement.

Exactly.

Read full topic
